full_threads.body: Logged a total of 30mins to Harvest

Hi Kasia,

We have now made these updates.

A couple of notes:

  1. We have added a signature field to the employee handbook file. Please review.
  2. We have added some text at the top of the page instructing the employees with the what to do. It currently reads: "Please download the form(s) you require. These will be saved to your device. Once you have completed your form(s), please save and email to hr@gpmgroup.com.au or print and drop into the office.". We can adjust this to suit your internal processes, please let us know what you would like to say in this section.

Let us know if you would like further changes.

@ricaV2

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi @ricaV2 done on the following updates

✅ Not able to complete any of the pdf's online anymore when downloaded (were sent over as editable pdfs)
- pdf is now editable

✅ Once employees complete the form, can they save it on the website or will they need to send it via email to us?
- after filling up the editable pdfs, they can download and send them back via email

For the employee handbook for example, are we able to create a function where employees need to sign they have read the form?
- for this task, I am not sure if the client wants to do the function inside the employee handbook pdf's? or a form on a website? @ricaV2 can we confirm with heath? 

Time: +15 mins

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Jaime Velasquez

full_threads.body:
Hi Rica Looks amazing, thanks so much. Just a few points:
  • Not able to complete any of the pdf's online anymore when downloaded (were sent over as editable pdfs)
  • Once employees complete the form, can they save it on the website or will they need to send it via email to us?
  • For the employee handbook for example, are we able to create a function where employees need to sign they have read the form?
Thanks so much again Kasia

Hi @ricaV2 done on the following task

1. Create new page titled: Employees ✅
2. Add the new page to main menu (screenshot) ✅
3. Page is to be protected by a generic password, please use ‘completeplumbing’ ✅
4. The page is to include H1, H2 and introductory paragraph (lorem ipsum holding copy is fine) ✅
5. The page is to include a listing view where resources can be downloaded (a layout similar to Momentum marketing resources) ✅
6. Upload the attached files for download. ✅

Please check and let me know if we have any changes, thanks

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Jaime Velasquez

full_threads.body:
Hi Rika,

Can you please help with the below request from Kasia @ https://completeplumbingdrainage.com.au/

Priority low (23rd - 25th November)

1. Create new page titled: Employees
2. Add the new page to main menu (screenshot)



3. Page is to be protected by a generic password, please use ‘completeplumbing’
4. The page is to include H1, H2 and introductory paragraph (lorem ipsum holding copy is fine)
5. The page is to include a listing view where resources can be downloaded (a layout similar to Momentum marketing resources)
6. Upload the attached files for download.



Please let me know if you need more information!

Hey Chris,

Can we please go ahead with starting to build out the Employee section of the website when you guys are next able to fit it in.

Attached is some starting documentation which will need to be included with more to come.

Will it be possible to section files? For example Onboarding folder, WH&S folder etc? or better to just have file dumb?

Thanks heaps 😊

Kasia

Subject: Re: Website adjustment for employees

‌
Hi Kasia,

Absolutely and we’d love to help.

We can create a section of the website that is only accessible with a common password. A breakdown of the process is as follows:

The password is provided to your new starter and allows them to access the information they are required to read
Once read, a form requires the new starter to check an 'I agree and acknowledge' message and sign (scribble with their finger on phone or mouse on computer) to acknowledge that they have read and understand the content

This type of task is billed out at $99/hour and would take approximately 4 hours.

We can get the ball rolling as early as this week. All that we need is the information to be contained on the page. I presume you have a PDF you can send over?

Regards,




‌


Chris Paradowski
Partnerships Manager
